messageBody:
If you want to test JavaScript then best to do your tests in the
browser. The best approach I can think of is this...

1) Create a frameset html document with two frames
2) Make the top frame link to you web app
3) Make the bottom page load your JScript test env
4) Script in the second frame is able to call methods in the app frame
and thus can assert certain conditions are true.
5) If you app is correctly put together is should be simple to place an
order and check the basket contains the order. You will probably need
to add call backs from the app to the test frame so the test knows when
the page has loaded.
5) In the test env have a button that runs all your tests. If an
assertion fails use myErrorDiv.innerText += "my failure" to report it

Also have a look at www.jsunit.net, I've just googled to find it but
don't know anything about it.

If you have any success with JSunit please report back to the group.

Dave
